text:
Lee County is a county found in the U.S. state of Mississippi. As of the 2010 census, 82,910 people lived there. Its county seat is Tupelo.
History.
Lee County was founded on October 26, 1866, and named for Robert E. Lee.
Geography.
According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the county has a total area of, of which is land and (0.7%) is water.
